question: An ant starts at point A on a number line. It takes 10 steps to the right, then 5 steps to the left, then 8 steps to the right. If the ant ends up at point B, which is located at -3 on the number line, where did the ant start (point A)?

A climber starts at a mountain base at an elevation of 0 meters. On the first day, he climbs 125 meters upwards. On the second day, due to bad weather, he descends 85 meters. On the third day, he climbs 140 meters upwards, but strong winds force him to descend 70 meters. On the fourth day, he climbs 100 meters upwards. What is the climber’s final elevation after four days?
